intro: Puccinellia intricata, commonly known as the intricate needlegrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its fine, wiry leaves and small, spike-like inflorescences. This species is typically found in arid and semi-arid regions, often growing in sandy or gravelly soils. Puccinellia intricata is adapted to harsh environments, demonstrating resilience to drought and salinity. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and forage for various wildlife species.
